description.narrative: The Strengthening Community Livelihoods in Timor-Leste HAFORSA Project (2015-20) contributes to equitable and resilient livelihood development, benefiting small-scale women and men producers from vulnerable communities through agricultural production improvements and access to finance and markets. The Strengthening Community Livelihoods in Timor-Leste project has four outcomes and end of project indicator targets. Outcome 1: Women and men in rural communities have improved income and food security. Baseline values of food security are 34.5% of sampled beneficiaries were food secure, 16.7% were mildly food insecure, 34.5% were moderately food insecure, and 14.3% were severely food insecure. Outcome 2: Vulnerable rural communities have improved resilience to shocks and stresses (fast and slow onset). Outcome 3: Vulnerable rural women and men are able to influence local and national decision-making processes that impact on their livelihoods and food security. Outcome 4: Effectively manage partnerships with local NGOs following Oxfam's partnerships principles.
